Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are commonly composed of ceramic compartments whose physical properties change according to the operating temperature.
Titulo: Electrochemical simulation using material properties of a ceramic electrode and electrolyte

Sentencas: Thus, the physical properties of ceramic materials must be accurately predicted in order to develop a reliable simulation model.
Titulo: Electrochemical simulation using material properties of a ceramic electrode and electrolyte

Sentencas: In this study, several physical properties that can affect the performance of SOFCs are studied using new simulation models.
Titulo: Electrochemical simulation using material properties of a ceramic electrode and electrolyte

Sentencas: Calculations are made of the Gibbs free energy for the open circuit voltage, the exchange current densities for the activation polarization and the ionic conductivity for the electrolyte.
Titulo: Electrochemical simulation using material properties of a ceramic electrode and electrolyte

Sentencas: In addition, the diffusion coefficients for the molecular and Knudsen diffusion mechanisms are determined for the mass transport analysis at the porous electrode.
Titulo: Electrochemical simulation using material properties of a ceramic electrode and electrolyte

Sentencas: The code is validated by comparing the results from the physical property models with the experimental results.
Titulo: Electrochemical simulation using material properties of a ceramic electrode and electrolyte

Sentencas: Then, the physical property models, the governing equations (mass, momentum, energy and species balance equations) and the electrochemical reaction models are run simultaneously for the multi-physics simulation.
Titulo: Electrochemical simulation using material properties of a ceramic electrode and electrolyte

Sentencas: The current density-voltage (IV) curves predicted by this multi-physics analysis shows values and trends that are similar to the experimental IV curves for various operating temperatures.
